page.title: 12RECREATION AT TEVIOTHEAD.
page.content: INDOOR{CARPET BOWLING}IS A GAME PLAYED IN TEVIOTHEAD HALL USING CARPETED BOARDS WITH WOOD BOWLS AND A JACK, ROLLED THROUGH A METAL HOOP TO BE SCORED WITHIN A CIRCLE AT THE END OF THE BOARD. BOWLING CLUB MEMBERS PLAY WEEKLY AND HAVE TOURNAMENTS WITH OTHER CLUBS.{TEVIOTDALE CURLING CLUB}PLAY AT KELSO 4O MILES AWAY, OTHERS SKI LOCALLY, RIDE,OR GO TO KEEP_FIT OR GYMNASTIC CLASSES. AT HOME PEOPLE READ, PLAY CARDS (PARTICULARY BRIDGE) AND DO GARDENING. PEOPLE COME HERE TO HUNT AND SHOOT.{THE TEVIOTHEAD} {SYNDICATE OF EIGHT GUNS}PAYING Â£1,000 EACH PER SEASON, LEASES SHOOTING OF GROUSE, PARTRIDGE,AND PHEASANT FROM BUCCLEUCH ESTATES. THIS FEE PAYS THE KEEPERS WAGES, COSTS OF RAISING YOUNG PHEASANTS, AND TIPS FOR THE BOY BEATERS.
